structure.unit: ARTICLE A. - STREET OBSTRUCTIONS AND ENCROACHMENTS
Sec. 12-1004. - CELLARS AND VAULTS UNDER SIDEWALKS.

text.section: No person shall appropriate any space under a sidewalk for cellar, vault or other underground uses without first obtaining approval of the Council. When approved, underground structures shall be constructed so as not to interfere with public utilities.
The sidewalk over any such underground space permitted shall be constructed and maintained by the owner of such structure so as to permit safe travel over the same by pedestrians.

The roof over any such underground space shall be of approved noncombustible material. Glass lights shall not be permitted within the sidewalk area over cellars, vaults or other underground structures. (Code 1959 , ยง19-5)
